title: WATCH: Referee Gives Red Card To Blackburn Player For The Stupidest Reason Ever
text:
WATCH: Referee Gives Red Card To Blackburn Player For The Stupidest Reason Ever Wed Feb 15 2017 15:02:29   15:02:29 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
Is it just me, or are refereeing standards dropping as the season goes on? 
Every week, an official is scrutinised for dubious decisions on the field, and last night, referee Scott Duncan continued that trend after he gave a controversial red card during Blackburn's visit to Sheffield Wednesday. 
Blackburn midfielder Hope Akpan was sent off in the 86th minute for the smallest push on Duncan, who's overreaction is just ridiculous. 
FACT: The fastest wind speed of all time was broken during the passage of Tropical Cyclone Olivia on 10 April 1996: It registered a maximum wind of 253mph. 
Rumours are now circulating that a similar gust of wind almost knocked referee Scott Duncan off his feet... Lmao these refs are too weak man :joy: pic.twitter.com/k075ZpvWuq 
Blackburn lost the match 2-1 as they slipped down to 23rd in the league. Sheffield Wednesday remained in sixth as they battle for the Championship promotion places. 
I can forgive referees for minor mistakes, but Akpan's red card is just plain wrong. Referee was appaling- if you can call him that. Scott Duncan is an embarrassment to referees and a coward - Daniel Ainsworth (@AinsworthD99) February 14, 2017 #Rovers Yes Akpan shouldn't have touched the ref, but Scott Duncan made such a meal faking his stumbling backward.
